channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: River Chelt Rubish, 21st March
item.description:
The banks of the river chelt along this stretch, which backs onto residential properties is strewn with rubbish. It was washed down stream after the heavy rain last month. The rubbish is not only an eye saw, but is also a danger to residents, with objects with sharp metallic edges. Some of the rubbish has built up so it hinders the river’s flow during heavy rain.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 Newland View, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent puddle of water, 20th March
item.description:
It may be nothing but this puddle has been there for a long time (many weeks) and I am wondering if it is a sign of a drainage issue or small leakage that may get worse if not investigated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 77a The Park, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole at least 4inch deep at centre, 20th March
item.description:
This pot hole has been getting wider over the last 2 months making it difficult to maneuver past with out vehicle hitting it causing issue to a vehicles tracking and stability. It is adjacent to the turning to a housing development on hanover street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Hanover Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement slab that has lifted outside River Island, 19th March
item.description:
My friend was walking past River Island and tripped on a raised loose paving stone. She fell and has broken a bone in each of her hands , has very severely bruised ribs and a badly grazed knee. This pavement is just one example of many in the town which are a real hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 151 High Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Sequence of potholes, 19th March
item.description:
There's a whole lot of potholes along this stretch of road. PLEASE don't just fill them individually - RESURFACE the road properly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Government Offices Parabola Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken drains, 20th March
item.description:
The drains have been identified as collapsed or broken for over ten years, yet repeatedly workmen come out and look at the problems with the same answer every time. When l explained the cement was being washed away and flooding my garage repeatedly on heavy rain one of your colleagues suggested I should contact my insurance company. I must say this upset me greatly. The water \ flooding is your fault and responsibility. Imagine trying to sell my house in the future with an insurance claim for flooding. I am not alone with the problem of this flooding as you are well aware, the road can be impassable for cars at times but. definitely dangerous for pedestrians. The constant flooding and power of the water has removed a large area of tarmac on the path which is very dangerous and will cause and accident Looking forward to the reply. Dave Pointon
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): St. Judes Green Lane, Witcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadwork notice in wrong place, 18th March
item.description:
The sign saying there will be roadworks on 22nd March 2021 is in the wrong place. It isIn the middle of Greenhills Road in Charlton Kings, but it needs to be at the Pilley Bridge roundabout , Charlton Lane so that people know they can’t get through at the end of that road. At the moment if they see the sign where it is they will have to do a three point turn in the middle of the road to be able to get out again. This is totally wrong and needs sorting out before the road works commence on the 22nd
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 111 Charlton Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
